content: in next single_crochet* around 18 4 single_crochet same single_crochet as joining and in next 5 single_crochet increase single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase single_crochet in 18 next 6 single_crochet chain 1 turn **you should be 2 stitches before where you would join** 5 on the wrong side 24 single_crochet in next 5 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 5 single_crochet bind off leaving a long tail to sew it to the head later on *this piece will lay flat and the shape should resemble an arch * page 5 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together here is a lady dangles i like to call her rosita with all her pieces laying out i always start by putting the head and body together since the head and body both ended with 18 stitches you should have no trouble sewing them together page 6 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com i like to put the arms on next put them a little forward of where human shoulders tend to be otherwise the arms look like they are behind the monkey you can tell where to put them by the way the decreases you made in the head are at next comes legs i just start one in what looks to be the center of the body between the arms i sew the legs between the 4th and 5th row from the bottom of the body page 7 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com next comes the tail as with the legs sew the tail on between row 4 and 5 for me the tail rarely lays over the back seam i sewed the face on next putting the flat piece up against the neck sew around the edges to secure the whole thing page 8 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com sew the ears on kind of low or else she ll look like a teddy bear close up of face with lower ears you also get an idea of face placement with this picture i usually make faces using 2 strands of 4-ply yarn i separate out 2 strands from the 4 it gets kind of tangly when you do that but once you start sewing with it it s ok page 9 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com dangles and rosita all put together i am not satisfied with the face i gave rosita so i m keeping it private for now lol have fun making your monkey and be creative page 10 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush
